champ.champInfo:
The overall management of the organization and conduct of the competition is carried out by the Department of Culture, Tourism, Youth and Sports of the Brodiv City Council and the Lviv Regional Kyokushin-Kan Karate-Do Federation. The responsibility for the preparation and direct holding of the competition rests with the Lviv Regional Federation of Kyokushin-kan Karate-do and the Chief Jury appointed for this competition.
The chief judge of the competition is a judge of the international category, Representative (Branch Chief) of the International Kyokushin-kan Karate-do organization in Ukraine, President of the Lviv Regional Federation of Kyokushin-kan karate-do Shihan Chungin M.P. (5 Dan)

National teams of city and regional Kyokushin-kan karate federations of Ukraine, individual clubs and other clubs that develop Kyokushin karate in Ukraine take part in the competition.

The competition is held on October 21, 2023


Competition program on October 20, 2023.

  • 10:00-17:00 - arrival of participating teams
  • 17:00-19:00 - mandate and medical commission, weighing, registration of participants, judges and team representatives
  • 19:00-21:00 - judges' seminar

Competition program for October 21, 2023.

  • 08:00 â€“ 09:00: registration of participants, mandate and medical commission, weighing
  • 09:30 - 10:00: ceremonial opening of the competition
  • 10:00 - 14:00: preliminary matches
  • 14:00 - 19:00: final matches
  • 19:00 - 20:00: end of competition, awarding of prize winners

Men's categories (KUMITE):

  • children U7: -25.0 -30.0 -35.0 35.0+
  • children U9: -25.0 -30.0 -35.0 -40.0 40.0+
  • children U11: -30.0 -35.0 -40.0 40.0+
  • boys U13: -40.0 -45.0 -50.0 50.0+
  • boys U15: -45.0 -50.0 -55.0 -60.0 60.0+
  • boys U17: -55.0 -60.0 -65.0 -70.0 70.0+
  • Youth U23: -70.0 -80.0 80.0+

Women's categories (KUMITE):

  • children U7: -25.0 25.0+
  • kids U9: -30.0 -35.0 35.0+
  • children U11: -35.0 -40.0 -40.0+
  • girls U13: -40.0 -45.0 45.0+
  • girls U15: -50.0 -55.0 55.0+
  • junior girls U17: -55.0 -60.0 60.0+
  • Youth U21: -55.0 -60.0 60.0+

In case of insufficient number of competition participants, availability of different levels and qualifications of athletes in a weight category or other reasons, for the purpose of high-quality and safe conduct of the competition, the organizers of the competition have the right to make the following changes:

  • combine some weight and age categories
  • introduce new weight and age categories
  • to hold competitions in the appropriate weight categories according to the round robin system

Match time

"Kumite" competition section.In this section of the competition, all participants, regardless of qualification level, perform together.

  • U7: qualifying matches - 1.0 min. + 1.0 min. Semi-final/final: 1.0 min. + 1.0 min. + weighing + 1.0 min. (The difference in weight is 1.5 kg)
  • U9: qualifying matches - 1.5 min. + 1.0 min. Semi-final/final: 1.5 min. + 1.5 min. + weighing + 1.0 min. (The difference in weight is 2 kg)
  • U11: qualifying matches - 1.5 min. + 1.0 min. Semi-final/final: 1.5 min. + 1.5 min. + weighing + 1.0 min. (The difference in weight is 2 kg)
  • U13: qualifying matches - 1.5 min. + 1.5 min. Semi-final/final: 1.5 min. + 1.5 min. + weighing + 1.0 min. (The difference in weight is 2 kg)
  • U15: qualifying matches - 2.0 min. + 2.0 min. Semi-final/final: 2.0 min. + 2.0 min. + weighing + 1.5 min. (The difference in weight is 2.5 kg)
  • U17: qualifying matches - 2.0 min. + 2.0 min. Semi-final/final: 2.0 min. + 2.0 min. + weighing + 1.5 min. (The difference in weight is 2.5 kg)
  • U23: Qualifying matches - 3.0 min. + 2.0 min. Semi-final/final: 3.0 min. + 2.0 min. + 2 min. + weighing + 2 min. (The difference in weight is 3 kg)

Rewarding

The winners and prize-winners of the competitions are awarded with cups, medals and diplomas of the respective degrees. Valuable and honorable prizes from the Lviv Regional Kyokushin-Kan Karate-Do Federation are awarded to athletes based on the results of the competition for the best technique and the will to win
